crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO DYNAMIC_DNS Query to *.duckdns. Domain
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET INFO DYNAMIC_DNS Query to *.duckdns. Domain"; dns.query; content:".duckdns."; nocase; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2022918; rev:4; metadata:created_at 2016_06_27, confidence Medium, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2022_11_30, reviewed_at 2024_04_16;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Observed File Sharing Service Download Domain (files .catbox .moe in TLS SNI)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tls $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Observed File Sharing Service Download Domain (files .catbox .moe in TLS SNI)"; flow:established,to_server; tls.sni; content:"files.catbox.moe"; bsize:16; fast_pattern; reference:url,catbox.moe; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2038639; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2022_08_29, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2022_08_29;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO DYNAMIC_DNS Query to a *.duckdns .org Domain
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET INFO DYNAMIC_DNS Query to a *.duckdns .org Domain"; dns.query; content:".duckdns.org"; fast_pattern; nocase; endswith; reference:url,changeip.com; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2042936; rev:2; metadata:attack_target Client_and_Server, created_at 2022_12_15, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2023_03_02, mitre_tactic_id TA0011, mitre_tactic_name Command_And_Control, mitre_technique_id T1568, mitre_technique_name Dynamic_Resolution;)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the execution of a Windows system binary that is usually located in the system folder from an uncommon location.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Patrick Bareiss, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

match_context.values: @{CommandLine="%windir%\system32\cscript.exe" /nologo %TEMP%\tmp6B9D.vbs; Image=%windir%\system32\cscript.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potentially Suspicious WDAC Policy File Creation
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious Windows Defender Application Control (WDAC) policy file creation from abnormal processes that could be abused by attacker to block EDR/AV components while allowing their own malicious code to run on the system.

match_context.values: @{Image=System; TargetFilename=C:\Windows\System32\CodeIntegrity\bootcat.cache; EventID=11}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

match_context.values: @{ [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=14; ScriptBlockId=b2e0dfbf-6272-4a09-8fb2-256bb2228db9; Path=C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=14}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may abuse the Windows command shell for execution.
The Windows command shell ([cmd](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0106)) is the primary command prompt on Windows systems.
The Windows command prompt can be used to control almost any aspect of a system, with various permission levels required for different subsets of commands.
Batch files (ex: .bat or .cmd) also provide the shell with a list of sequential commands to run, as well as normal scripting operations such as conditionals and loops.
Common uses of batch files include long or repetitive tasks, or the need to run the same set of commands on multiple system

match_context.values: @{ [TRUNCATED]; Path=C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1; ScriptBlockId=b2e0dfbf-6272-4a09-8fb2-256bb2228db9; MessageTotal=14; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=14}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of PowerShell to identify the current logged user.

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=$userName = $env:USERNAME;$gvt = "C:\Users\$userName\dwm.bat";if (Test-Path $gvt) {    Write-Host "Batch file found: $gvt" -ForegroundColor Cyan;    $fileLines = [System.IO.File]::ReadAllLines($gvt, [System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8);    foreach ($line in $fileLines) {        if ($line -match '^::: ?(.+)$') {            Write-Host "Injection code detected in the batch file." -ForegroundColor Cyan;            try {                $decodedBytes = [System.Convert]::FromBase64String($matches[1].Trim());  [TRUNCATED]; Path=; ScriptBlockId=32ff32c2-7340-4420-ada9-7e8c98dff336; MessageTotal=1; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}
